item.title: Docs: .activate_all_osm_railway_types()
item.description:
Description

Option to activate all supported OSM railway types in the parser, resulting in the most detailed network possible. Note that this will - for example - also include miniature railways and narrow gauge tracks.

Signature

.activate_all_osm_railway_types()

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# indicate to activate all supported OSM railway types for parsing all rail based infrastructure
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.activate_all_osm_railway_types()

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .activate_osm_rail_mode(+)
item.description:
Description

Activate chosen OSM rail mode.

Signature

.activate_osm_rail_mode(osm_mode: str)

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
osm_mode str None N/A OSM rail mode

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# activate funicular mode
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_osm_rail_mode("funicular")

See also

N/A

Source code

item.title: Docs: .activate_osm_railway_types(+)
item.description:
Description

Activate selected OSM railway types explicitly on top of the default activated types.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.activate_osm_railway_types(railway_types: List[str])

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_types List of String None N/A Explicitly activated OSM railway types

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# indicate to activate narrow gauge and monorail explicitly
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.activate_osm_railway_types(["narrow_gauge","monorail"])

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .deactivate_all_osm_rail_modes_except(+)
item.description:
Description

Deactivate all OSM rail modes except the ones indicated.

Signature

.deactivate_all_rail_modes_except(modes: List[str])

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
modes List of String None N/A OSM rail modes that are not to be deactivated

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# deactivate all modes except trains
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_all_osm_rail_modes_except(["train"])

See also

item.title: Docs: .deactivate_all_osm_railway_types()
item.description:
Description

Deactivate all OSM railway types that are supported. Only to be used when other types are activated later on, if not it is suggested to simply deactivate the railway parser.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.deactivate_all_osm_railway_types()

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# deactivate all then activate regular rail
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_all_osm_railway_types()
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.activate_osm_railway_types(["rail"])

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .deactivate_osm_rail_modes(+)
item.description:
Description

Deactivate chosen OSM rail modes that are currently activated and supported.

Signature

.deactivate_osm_rail_modes(modes: List[str])

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
modes List of String None N/A OSM rail modes that are to be deactivated

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# deactivate regular trains and funicular from the rail modes to parse
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_osm_rail_modes(["train","funicular"])

N/A

item.title: Docs: .deactivate_osm_railway_type(+)
item.description:
Description

Deactivate a selected OSM railway type explicitly.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.deactivate_osm_railway_type(railway_type:str)

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_type String None N/A Explicitly deactivated OSM railway type

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# indicate to deactivate parsing any lighrail and tram based infrastructure
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_osm_railway_type("light_rail")
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.deactivate_osm_railway_type("tram")

See also

N/A

item.title: Docs: .get_default_speed_limit_by_osm_railway_type(+)
item.description:
Description

Get the current default speed limit (km/h) for a given railway type.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.get_default_speed_limit_by_osm_railway_type(railway_type: str) -> float

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_type str None N/A The OSM wailway type’s speed limit

Return type

float

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# example Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# get the default speed limit for primary OSM highway type
speed_km_h = osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.get_default_speed_limit_by_osm_railway_type("rail")

See also

N/A

Source code

item.title: Docs: .get_mapped_osm_rail_modes(+)
item.description:
Description

Get the OSM modes that are mapped to the provided PLANit predefined mode.

More information on OSM modes; https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:access

Signature

.get_mapped_osm_rail_modes(planit_mode: PredefinedModeType) -> List[str]

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
planit_mode PredefinedModeType None N/A PLANit mode

Return type

List[str] osm rail modes as list of string

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# get mapped OSM modes
osm_car_modes: List[str] = osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.get_mapped_osm_rail_modes(PredefinedModeType.TRAIN)

See also

N/A

Source code

network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader

osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

item.title: Docs: .is_osm_railway_type_activated(+)
item.description:
Description

Verify if a given railway type is activated. When activated the parser will consider the type, when deactivated it is ignored when parsing.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.is_osm_railway_type_activated(railway_type: str)-> bool

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_type str None N/A The OSM railway type

Return type

bool

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# example Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# Verify if a "rail" has been acivated
assert osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.is_osm_railway_type_activated("rail") is True

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .is_osm_railway_type_deactivated(+)
item.description:
Description

Verify if a given railway type is deactivated. When activated the parser will consider the type, when deactivated it is ignored when parsing.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railway types’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.is_osm_railway_type_deactivated(railway_type: str)-> bool

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_type str None N/A The OSM railway type

Return type

bool

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# example Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# Verify if a "rail" has been deacivated
assert osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.is_osm_railway_type_deactivated("rail") is False

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py

item.title: Docs: .overwrite_capacity_max_density_defaults(+)
item.description:
Description

Override the default capacity (pcu/h/lane) and maximum density (pcu/km/lane) for the given OSM railway type. It is unlikely that these values are utilised in public transport assignment since they generally do not rely on capacity and maximum density of the infrastructure. Still, they are available analogous to road based infrastructure.

Original defaults are country specific and when no country is provided to the reader, the global defaults will be in place.

The provided types need to be in line with the OSM railwaytypes’ name as outlined by Open Street Maps, see also https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:railway

Signature

.overwrite_capacity_max_density_defaults(railway_type:str, capacity:float, max_density:float)

with

Parameter Type Unit Default Description
railway_type String None N/A OSM railway type to set the new defaults for
capacity Float pcu/h/lane N/A New capacity to use
max_density Float pcu/km/lane N/A New maximum density to use

Return type

N/A

Example 1

from planit import *

# create a network converter
planit_instance = Planit()
network_converter = planit_instance.converter_factory.create(ConverterType.NETWORK)

# Open Street Map (OSM) network reader        
osm_reader = network_converter.create_reader(NetworkReaderType.OSM, "<country_name>")
osm_reader.settings.set_input_file("<path_to_input_file>")

# set new defaults for capacity and max density on regular rail (just an example, likely no suitable for any assignment)
osm_reader.settings.activate_railway_parser(True)
osm_reader.settings.railway_settings.overwrite_capacity_max_density_defaults("rail", 10000, 2)

See also

N/A

Source code

Class OsmRailwaySettingsWrapper in converterwrappers.py
